direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods send messages (request vs. indication) to a specified destination through a specified local address, handling similar exception scenarios.
Both methods involve sending messages (request vs. response) and handle similar types of exceptions and IO operations.
Both methods send messages (request vs. raw UDP message) and handle similar exception scenarios related to network operations.
Both methods send different types of data (request vs. channel data) through specified addresses, with similar exception handling.
Both methods send messages (request vs. generic message) through specified addresses, with similar control flow and exception handling.
Both methods send data (request vs. byte array) through specified addresses, with similar control flow and exception handling.
Both methods send different types of data (request vs. channel data) through specified addresses, with similar control flow and exception handling.
Both methods handle message events and manage exceptions similarly, particularly in terms of network and IO exceptions.
Both methods access and validate message attributes, handling similar types of exceptions and validation logic.
Both methods manage transactions, with sendRequest initiating transactions and cancelTransaction managing their lifecycle.
